abstract: Pfizer, the giant drug maker, has sold $13.5 billion worth of bonds to replace short-term loans covering about one-third of the cost of its planned acquisition of its rival Wyeth, The Associated Press said.
lead_paragraph: Pfizer, the giant drug maker, has sold $13.5 billion worth of bonds to replace short-term loans covering about one-third of the cost of its planned acquisition of its rival Wyeth, The Associated Press said.

headline.main: Pfizer Sells $13.5 Billion in Bonds for Wyeth Deal
